title: Part E
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide both the correct geometry and a valid explanation equivalent to the following.

· The molecular geometry is square pyramidal. Given the asymmetric arrangement of atoms relative to the lone pair of electrons, it is impossible for all of the individual bond dipoles to cancel completely.

The response provides both the correct geometry and a valid explanation equivalent to the following.

· The molecular geometry is square pyramidal. Given the asymmetric arrangement of atoms relative to the lone pair of electrons, it is impossible for all of the individual bond dipoles to cancel completely.

title: Part F

descriptions: The response does not state that both substances have London dispersion forces.
The response states that both substances have London dispersion forces.

title: Part G
stimulusHtml: Select a point value to view scoring criteria, solutions, and/or examples and to score the response.
descriptions:
The response does not provide a valid explanation equivalent to the following.

· XeF 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C6A@ is a nonpolar substance and Xe MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGybGaaeyzaaaa@3ABE@ is an atomic element. Both substances experience only London dispersion forces, but XeF 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C6A@ has more electrons and therefore a larger, more polarizable electron cloud than Xe MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGybGaaeyzaaaa@3ABE@ , resulting in stronger total intermolecular forces than Xe MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGybGaaeyzaaaa@3ABE@ . As a result, XeF 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C6A@ has the higher boiling point.

The response provides a valid explanation equivalent to the following.

· XeF 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C6A@ is a nonpolar substance and Xe MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGybGaaeyzaaaa@3ABE@ is an atomic element. Both substances experience only London dispersion forces, but XeF 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C6A@ has more electrons and therefore a larger, more polarizable electron cloud than Xe MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGybGaaeyzaaaa@3ABE@ , resulting in stronger total intermolecular forces than Xe MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLnhiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbtv2zVvgiqjxAUrharqqtubsr4rNCHbGeaGqiFC0pg9uqGrpepeea0dXdHaVhbbe9u8qqaqFr0xc9pk0xj9qqaqFj0dh9qq=xfr=JarFfpeea0=as0=fs0di9uqFr0=vr0=vr0db8meaabaqaciGacaGaaeqabaWaaeGaeaaakeaacaqGybGaaeyzaaaa@3ABE@ . As a result, XeF 4 MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3C6A@ has the higher boiling point.
